revised_title: A Reexamination of Buriadia heterophylla: Structure and Fructification
tldr: This study examines the structure and fructification of Buriadia heterophylla, a rare fossil plant from the Gondwana period. The researchers discovered new seeds and analyzed the plant's external and internal morphology, providing insights into its classification and relationships with other ancient plants. The findings suggest that Buriadia heterophylla may be a unique type of conifer or a plant not easily assignable to any known group of gymnosperms.
